dcterms:description: A framework used to synthesize distorted audio clips by applying network traces captured from actual Skype voice calls, simulating speech distortion due to network conditions.
dcterms:title: Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF)

dcterms:description: A dataset created for the study consisting of 5000 audio clips uniformly distributed across various impairment types, including background noise, reverberation, speech distortion, and low volume.
dcterms:title: Audio dataset (synthesized dataset of 5000 audio clips)

dcterms:description: A crowdsourcing platform used to obtain noisy labels for audio clips from non-expert listeners, providing a cost-effective way to gather annotations.
dcterms:title: Microsoftâ€™s Universal Human Relevance System (UHRS)

dcterms:creator: ITU-T
dcterms:description: An objective method for end-to-end speech quality assessment of narrowband telephone networks and speech codecs.
dcterms:title: Perceptual Evaluation of Speech Quality (PESQ)

dcterms:creator: J. G. Beerends
H. Gamper
C. Reddy
R. Cutler
I. Tashev
J. Gehrke
dcterms:description: The third generation ITU-T standard for end-to-end speech quality measurement, focusing on temporal alignment.
dcterms:title: Perceptual Objective Listening Quality Assessment (POLQA)
